data.title: Edgar Rice Burroughs (1875-1950)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? data.text:
Edgar Rice Burroughs

Born 1 Sep 1875 in Chicago, Cook, Illinois, United States

Ancestors

Brother of Henry Studley Burroughs

Husband of Emma Centennia (Hulbert) Burroughs — married 31 Jan 1900 (to 1934) in Chicago, Cook, Illinois, United States

Husband of Florence Ella (Gleistein) Gilbert — married 1934 (to 1941) in Los Angeles, Los Angeles, California, United States

Died 19 Mar 1950 at age 74 in Encino, Los Angeles, California, United States

Profile last modified 23 Apr 2024 | Created 13 Oct 2011

This page has been accessed 4,518 times.

Biography

Edgar Burroughs is Notable.

Burroughs, Edgar Rice (1875-1950), American novelist, born in Chicago, Illinois. Burroughs was a soldier, business executive, gold miner, cowboy, storekeeper, and policeman before he turned to writing as a career. He is known chiefly as the creator of the character of Tarzan, who first appeared in Tarzan of the Apes (1914). More than 20 novels depicting the adventures of Tarzan achieved widespread popularity. The Tarzan books have been translated into more than 50 languages, have sold more than 20 million copies, and have served as the basis for motion pictures, radio serials, television shows, and a comic strip. Burroughs also is known for his science fiction writing. More than 60 of his books have been published.

He is buried under the walnut tree at 18352 Ventura Blvd, Tarzana. There is a marker in the sidewalk at 18663 Ventura Blvd.[1]
